page.title: 02THE ECOLOGY OF HARMBY AREA
page.content: THE LAND IN THIS VERY PICTURESQUE AREA HAS VERY LOW HILLS.IT SLOPES DOWN TO THE RIVER URE.THERE ARE SMALL AREAS OF WOODLAND.THE REST IS MOSTLY FARMLAND. OUR WEATHER IS VERY CHANGEABLE.IN RECENT WINTERS WE HAVE HAD THE ROADS BLOCKED BY TEN FOOT SNOW DRIFTS,BUT SOME WINTERS ARE VERY MILD.IN SUMMER THE WEATHER ALSO VARIES AND WE GET QUITE A LOT OF RAIN.THIS AREA IS RICH IN PLANT AND ANIMAL LIFE.YOU CAN SEE FOXES,BADGERS,SQUIRRELS,STOATS,WEASELS POLECATS AND OTTERS.THERE ARE ALSO MINK AND DEER WHICH HAVE ESCAPED TO THE WILD.MANY WILD BIRDS NEST HERE INCLUDING ROBINS,WRENS,SWIFTS, PARTRIDGE,DOVE,HERON,SWANS,DUCKS,COOTS ,GOLDFINCH,GREAT TITS,HOUSE MARTINS AND WAGTAILS.THERE ARE LARGE AREAS OF WOODLAND WHICH HAVE BEEN PLANTED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION.
